subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory
Mitochondrial Dynamics and ROS-Mediated Aging Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS as damaging agents causing oxidative damage to macromolecules driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS production and oxidative damage to mtDNA as key aging drivers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial ROS production rates to lifespan differences and oxidative damage accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related increase in mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative stress and cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details mitochondrial energy decline, mtDNA mutations, and increased ROS causing oxidative damage in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial oxidative damage due to SOD2 deficiency causing systemic aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights complex I ROS production causing mtDNA damage and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Classic mitochondrial free radical theory emphasizing ROS-driven damage accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA mutations increasing ROS and lipid peroxidation driving aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS imbalance and oxidative damage as aging drivers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mtDNA instability and oxidative stress as genetic regulators of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows mitochondrial ROS generation and mtDNA instability causing aging in Podospora anserina.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mitochondria as reactive species sinks reducing oxidative damage and promoting longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial complex II-generated mtROS as pro-longevity signaling molecules.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial respiratory threshold and ROS signaling inducing adaptive stress responses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitohormesis theory where transient mtROS induce protective stress responses extending lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mild mitochondrial dysfunction triggers hormetic stress responses mediated by p53/cep-1 for longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: RNAi of ETC components modulates ROS signaling and mitohormesis to extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: clk-1 gene modulates mitochondrial respiration and ROS signaling affecting aging and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: CycD/Cdk4 activity imbalance alters mitochondrial biogenesis and ROS signaling causing neurodegeneration and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and ROS-Mediated Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: OPA1 insufficiency disrupts mitochondrial fusion, increases ROS, and accelerates aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and ROS-Mediated Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Unopposed mitochondrial fission causes fragmentation, ROS sensitivity, apoptosis, and lifespan shortening.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and ROS-Mediated Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Uncoupling protein-2 reduces ROS production via mitochondrial uncoupling, promoting longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and ROS-Mediated Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitochondrial oxidative stress and dysfunction theory emphasizing redox regulation and antioxidant defenses.
